Fixed an issue with calling for ticker data and removed natural language initialization if you don't call --natural-lang

Update 1.1.0

Fix for the training algorithm, now works in months rather than years and get data in 1min increments. You will need to use less time to train correctly. It also saves models by every episode now. Better logging as well.

Many Crucial Updates, and Features Added

Added the use of Flair as a default sentiment analysis tool instead of Natural Language. You can still call Natural Language by adding the --natural-lang argument. 

Added more in depth logging including positive and negative attributions to each specific article. Also finished more in depth training, now it is entirely automated and seems to work quite well.

Got the countdown timer to work in eval.py between days, so that will make my life easier and allows for less api calls and less cpu usage. Total overhaul of requirements.txt again, hopefully should work most of the time.

Also fixed deprecated libraries from Python 3.6

Caught a lot more errors, mostly connection errors so that the bot wouldn't crash if you lost internet, it will now retry the connection 30 times before giving up. Fixed the training a bit more, added some more unique features to keep it a little more automated and take a little less long. Still working on testing the training a little more, expect more updates. Also fixed a bug where each column didn't line up when trading which made it difficult to read. Also added a countdown timer at the end of each trading day so you could see how long there was before the market opens. The largest fix was updating the requirements file, which had seemed to miss many packages that were required. Now it should install most* of them, you will get an error if you try to run and one isn't installed. A quick install of one or two should fix the issue.

Hopefully fixed train.py
Bot now works in real time and will update models every day with predictions from the previous day

FLAIR-NER: All tests running. Preliminary completion of the current work.

The `jcore-flair-ner-ae` is now able to return the contextualized
word embeddings created for sequence tagging. Those are added to the
`Token.embeddingVectors` feature and can thus be used in downstream
tasks.
Note that the tests will currently not run due to the fact that
the required flair version is a nightly build that allows to read
the word embeddings after sequence tagging. This will be fixed
by the next flair release or the use of the nightly build in travis.

FLAIR-NER: Running tests for subtoken and all token embedding returning.

Note that for the current version of the flair-ner-ae to run,
a nightly version of flair is required. Thus, the travis build will
fail.
FLAIR-NER: Test with returned embeddings for the found entities is working.
FLAIR-NER: Now using binary responses. The goal is to also receive word embeddings.

Flair NER tagger: Fixed a bug with offset missmatches.

to the python script but the offsets were resolved against tokens
Now the sent text is also tokenized because we train this way (FLAIR
trains with data in IOB format).

Added a ready signal to the flair NER script.

Which is necessary since flair 0.4.1 when NVIDIA apex is not installed
because then the program will output a note about better performance
with apex wich was mistaken for actual result output.
